zebra4j

Class QuestionPuzzleGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • zebra4j.AbstractPuzzleGenerator<QuestionPuzzle>
      • zebra4j.QuestionPuzzleGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Supplier<QuestionPuzzle>

    @ThreadSafe
public class QuestionPuzzleGenerator
extends AbstractPuzzleGenerator<QuestionPuzzle>
    A generator for QuestionPuzzle

    You can use the same generator to create multiple different puzzles by calling the AbstractPuzzleGenerator.generate() method multiple times. All generated puzzles will have the same question, attributes and solution but will have different facts (clues). The generated puzzles will not contain facts the directly answer the question.

      • removeFacts

        protected void removeFacts(java.util.List<Fact> facts)
        Optimized facts pruning for QuestionPuzzle

        The implementation in the super class is correct for question puzzles but not optimal. The major optimization below is looking for a single solution in a puzzle with an additional fact that excludes the starting one. This is equivalent to iterating over solutions looking for one different than the starting solution but pushes the search down to the solver which is faster.

        Another minor optimization is reducing the amount of allocations. This implementation uses a single solver/puzzle and does one less copy of the facts per iteration. That does not reduce wall clock time - copying and cleanup are extremely fast, while GC runs in parallel. However, overall CPU usage is reduced because GC has less to do. In environments with less efficient GC, like TeaVM or native, wall clock time is decreased.

        Overrides:
        removeFacts in class AbstractPuzzleGenerator<QuestionPuzzle>
        Parameters:
        facts - initial list of facts with which the puzzle has a unique solution
